title: Norman Partridge
text:
Norman Partridge (born May 28, 1958) is an <a href="American%20literature">American author</a> of <a href="horror%20fiction">horror</a> and <a href="mystery%20fiction">mystery fiction</a>. He has written two detective novels about retired <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> Jack Baddalach, "Saguaro Riptide" and "The Ten Ounce Siesta". He is also the author of a <a href="The%20Crow">Crow</a> novel, "", which was adapted in 2005 into the fourth Crow movie, bearing the same name.
Mr. Partridge's 2006 novel <a href="Dark%20Harvest%20%28novel%29">"Dark Harvest"</a>, published in a <a href="Limited%20edition%20books">limited edition</a> of 2000 <a href="autographed">autographed</a> copies and 24 <a href="lettered%20edition">lettered edition</a> copies by <a href="Cemetery%20Dance%20Publications">Cemetery Dance Publications</a>, was voted one of <a href="Publishers%20Weekly">Publishers Weekly's</a> 100 Best Books of 2006. It also won the 2006 <a href="Bram%20Stoker%20Award">Bram Stoker Award</a> for <a href="Bram%20Stoker%20Award%20for%20Best%20Long%20Fiction">Best Long Fiction</a>, and has been nominated for two more awards in 2007. "Dark Harvest" is in film production at MGM Film Group
His <a href="short%20stories">short stories</a> are collected in the volumes "Mr. Fox and Other Feral Tales", "Bad Intentions", and "The Man with the Barbed Wire Fists".
Partridge works as the library's evening circulation supervisor at <a href="Saint%20Mary%27s%20College%20of%20California">Saint Mary's College of California</a>. He gave a campus reading of "Dark Harvest" on October 30, 2019.
